mechanics.condition: Target is a manufactured metal object within range AND a creature is in physical contact with the object

mechanics.trigger: Use bonus action on subsequent turns (while spell is active)
mechanics.condition: Creature is in physical contact with the heated object

mechanics.trigger: Creature takes fire damage from the heated object while holding or wearing it
mechanics.condition: Creature fails a Constitution saving throw
mechanics.outcome: Creature must drop the object if it can

mechanics.trigger: Creature takes fire damage from the heated object while holding or wearing it
mechanics.condition: Creature fails a Constitution saving throw AND does NOT drop the object
mechanics.outcome: Creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the start of its next turn

description_text: Choose a manufactured metal object, such as a metal weapon or a suit of heavy or medium metal armor, that you can see within range. You cause the object to glow red-hot. Any creature in physical contact with the object takes 2d8 fire damage when you cast the spell. Until the spell ends, you can use a bonus action on each of your subsequent turns to cause this damage again. If a creature is holding or wearing the object and takes the damage from it, the creature must succeed on a constitution saving throw or drop the object if it can. If it doesn't drop the object, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the start of your next turn.
